BreakpointPathlossModel Class Reference
[analogueModels - AnalogueModel implementations]

Basic implementation of a BreakpointPathlossModel. This class can be used to implement the ieee802154 path loss model. More...

#include <BreakpointPathlossModel.h>

Inherits AnalogueModel.

Detailed Description

Basic implementation of a BreakpointPathlossModel. This class can be used to implement the ieee802154 path loss model.

Definition at line 15 of file BreakpointPathlossModel.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

BreakpointPathlossModel::BreakpointPathlossModel ( double  L01,
double  L02,
double  alpha1,
double  alpha2,
double  breakpointDistance,
double  carrierFrequency,
bool  useTorus,
const Coord &  playgroundSize,
bool  debug 
) [inline]

Initializes the analogue model. playgroundSize need to be valid as long as this instance exists.

The constructor needs some specific knowledge in order to create its mapping properly:

Parameters:
alpha the coefficient alpha (specified e.g. in config.xml and passed in constructor call)
carrierFrequency the carrier frequency
useTorus information about the playground the host is moving in
playgroundSize information about the playground the host is moving in
debug display debug messages?

00013                   : receiverPos.sqrdist(sendersPos);
00014   distance = sqrt(distance);
00015   debugEV << "distance is: " << distance << endl;
00016 
00017   if(distance <= 1.0) {
00018     //attenuation is negligible
00019     return;
00020   }
00021 
00022   double attenuation = 1;
00023   // PL(d) = PL0 + 10 alpha log10 (d/d0)
00024   // 10 ^ { PL(d)/10 } = 10 ^{PL0 + 10 alpha log10 (d/d0)}/10
00025   // 10 ^ { PL(d)/10 } = 10 ^ PL0/10 * 10 ^ { 10 log10 (d/d0)^alpha }/10
00026   // 10 ^ { PL(d)/10 } = 10 ^ PL0/10 * 10 ^ { log10 (d/d0)^alpha }
00027   // 10 ^ { PL(d)/10 } = 10 ^ PL0/10 * (d/d0)^alpha
00028   if(distance < breakpointDistance) {
00029     attenuation = attenuation * PL01_real;
00030     attenuation = attenuation * pow(distance, alpha1);
00031   } else {
00032     attenuation = attenuation * PL02_real;
00033     attenuation = attenuation * pow(distance/breakpointDistance, alpha2);
00034   }
00035   attenuation = 1/attenuation;
00036   debugEV << "attenuation is: " << attenuation << endl;
00037 
00038   if(debug) {
00039     pathlosses.record(10*log10(attenuation)); // in dB
00040   }
00041 
00042   //const DimensionSet& domain = DimensionSet::timeDomain;
00043   Argument arg; // default constructor initializes with a single dimension, time, and value 0 (offset from signal start)
00044   TimeMapping<Linear>* attMapping = new TimeMapping<Linear> (); // mapping performs a linear interpolation from our single point -> constant
00045   attMapping->setValue(arg, attenuation);
00046 
00047   /* at last add the created attenuation mapping to the signal */
00048   signal.addAttenuation(attMapping);
